verses.verse: I <S%H3772>made<s%> a <S%H1285>covenant<s%> with mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>; why then should I <S%H995>think<s%> upon a <S%H1330>maid<s%>?
For what <S%H2506>portion<s%> of <S%H433>God<s%> is there from <S%H4605>above<s%>? and what <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> of the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> from on <S%H4791>high<s%>?
Is not <S%H343>destruction<s%> to the <S%H5767>wicked<s%>? and a <S%H5235>strange<s%> punishment to the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>?
Doth not he <S%H7200>see<s%> my <S%H1870>ways<s%>, and <S%H5608>count<s%> all my <S%H6806>steps<s%>?
If I have <S%H1980>walked<s%> with <S%H7723>vanity<s%>, or if my <S%H7272>foot<s%> hath <S%H2363>hasted<s%> to <S%H4820>deceit<s%>;
Let me be <S%H8254>weighed<s%> in an <S%H6664>even<s%> <S%H3976>balance<s%>, that <S%H433>God<s%> may <S%H3045>know<s%> mine <S%H8538>integrity<s%>.

If my <S%H838>step<s%> hath turned <S%H5186>out<s%> of the <S%H1870>way<s%>, and mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H1980>walked<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, and if any <S%H3971>blot<s%> hath <S%H1692>cleaved<s%> to mine <S%H3709>hands<s%>;
Then let me <S%H2232>sow<s%>, and let <S%H312>another<s%> <S%H398>eat<s%>; yea, let my <S%H6631>offspring<s%> be rooted <S%H8327>out<s%>.
If mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> have been <S%H6601>deceived<s%> by a <S%H802>woman<s%>, or if I have laid <S%H693>wait<s%> at my <S%H7453>neighbour's<s%> <S%H6607>door<s%>;
Then let my <S%H802>wife<s%> <S%H2912>grind<s%> unto <S%H312>another<s%>, and let <S%H312>others<s%> bow <S%H3766>down<s%> upon her.
For this is an heinous <S%H2154>crime<s%>; yea, it is an <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> to be punished by the <S%H6414>judges<s%>.
For it is a <S%H784>fire<s%> that <S%H398>consumeth<s%> to <S%H11>destruction<s%>, and would root <S%H8327>out<s%> all mine <S%H8393>increase<s%>.
If I did <S%H3988>despise<s%> the <S%H4941>cause<s%> of my <S%H5650>manservant<s%> or of my <S%H519>maidservant<s%>, when they <S%H7379>contended<s%> with me;
What then shall I <S%H6213>do<s%> when <S%H410>God<s%> riseth <S%H6965>up<s%>? and when he <S%H6485>visiteth<s%>, what shall I <S%H7725>answer<s%> him?
Did not he that <S%H6213>made<s%> me in the <S%H990>womb<s%> <S%H6213>make<s%> him? and did not <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H3559>fashion<s%> us in the <S%H7358>womb<s%>?
If I have <S%H4513>withheld<s%> the <S%H1800>poor<s%> from their <S%H2656>desire<s%>, or have caused the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of the <S%H490>widow<s%> to <S%H3615>fail<s%>;
Or have <S%H398>eaten<s%> my <S%H6595>morsel<s%> myself alone, and the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%> hath not <S%H398>eaten<s%> thereof;
(For from my <S%H5271>youth<s%> he was brought <S%H1431>up<s%> with me, as with a <S%H1>father<s%>, and I have <S%H5148>guided<s%> her from my <S%H517>mother's<s%> <S%H990>womb<s%>;)
If I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> any <S%H6>perish<s%> for want of <S%H3830>clothing<s%>, or any <S%H34>poor<s%> without <S%H3682>covering<s%>;
If his <S%H2504>loins<s%> have not <S%H1288>blessed<s%> me, and if he were not <S%H2552>warmed<s%> with the <S%H1488>fleece<s%> of my <S%H3532>sheep<s%>;
If I have lifted <S%H5130>up<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> against the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, when I <S%H7200>saw<s%> my <S%H5833>help<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate<s%>:
Then let mine <S%H3802>arm<s%> <S%H5307>fall<s%> from my shoulder <S%H7929>blade<s%>, and mine <S%H248>arm<s%> be <S%H7665>broken<s%> from the <S%H7070>bone<s%>.
For <S%H343>destruction<s%> from <S%H410>God<s%> was a <S%H6343>terror<s%> to me, and by reason of his <S%H7613>highness<s%> I <S%H3201>could<s%> not endure.
If I have <S%H7760>made<s%> <S%H2091>gold<s%> my <S%H3689>hope<s%>, or have <S%H559>said<s%> to the fine <S%H3800>gold<s%>, Thou art my <S%H4009>confidence<s%>;
If I <S%H8055>rejoiced<s%> because my <S%H2428>wealth<s%> was <S%H7227>great<s%>, and because mine <S%H3027>hand<s%> had <S%H4672>gotten<s%> <S%H3524>much<s%>;
If I <S%H7200>beheld<s%> the <S%H216>sun<s%> when it <S%H1984>shined<s%>, or the <S%H3394>moon<s%> <S%H1980>walking<s%> in <S%H3368>brightness<s%>;
And my <S%H3820>heart<s%> hath been <S%H5643>secretly<s%> <S%H6601>enticed<s%>, or my <S%H6310>mouth<s%> hath <S%H5401>kissed<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%>:
This also were an <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> to be punished by the <S%H6416>judge<s%>: for I should have <S%H3584>denied<s%> the <S%H410>God<s%> that is <S%H4605>above<s%>.
If I <S%H8055>rejoiced<s%> at the <S%H6365>destruction<s%> of him that <S%H8130>hated<s%> me, or lifted <S%H5782>up<s%> myself when <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H4672>found<s%> him:
Neither have I <S%H5414>suffered<s%> my <S%H2441>mouth<s%> to <S%H2398>sin<s%> by <S%H7592>wishing<s%> a <S%H423>curse<s%> to his <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
If the <S%H4962>men<s%> of my <S%H168>tabernacle<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> not, Oh that we <S%H5414>had<s%> of his <S%H1320>flesh<s%>! we cannot be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>.
The <S%H1616>stranger<s%> did not <S%H3885>lodge<s%> in the <S%H2351>street<s%>: but I <S%H6605>opened<s%> my <S%H1817>doors<s%> to the <S%H734>traveller<s%>.
If I <S%H3680>covered<s%> my <S%H6588>transgressions<s%> as <S%H121>Adam<s%>, by <S%H2934>hiding<s%> mine <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> in my <S%H2243>bosom<s%>:

Did I <S%H6206>fear<s%> a <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H1995>multitude<s%>, or did the <S%H937>contempt<s%> of <S%H4940>families<s%> <S%H2865>terrify<s%> me, that I kept <S%H1826>silence<s%>, and went not <S%H3318>out<s%> of the <S%H6607>door<s%>?

Oh <S%H5414>that<s%> one would <S%H8085>hear<s%> me! behold, my <S%H8420>desire<s%> is, that the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> would <S%H6030>answer<s%> me, and that mine <S%H376%H7379>adversary<s%> had <S%H3789>written<s%> a <S%H5612>book<s%>.
Surely I would <S%H5375>take<s%> it upon my <S%H7926>shoulder<s%>, and <S%H6029>bind<s%> it as a <S%H5850>crown<s%> to me.
I would <S%H5046>declare<s%> unto him the <S%H4557>number<s%> of my <S%H6806>steps<s%>; as a <S%H5057>prince<s%> would I go <S%H7126>near<s%> unto him.
If my <S%H127>land<s%> <S%H2199>cry<s%> against me, or that the <S%H8525>furrows<s%> <S%H3162>likewise<s%> thereof <S%H1058>complain<s%>;
If I have <S%H398>eaten<s%> the <S%H3581>fruits<s%> thereof without <S%H3701>money<s%>, or have caused the <S%H1167>owners<s%> thereof to <S%H5301>lose<s%> their <S%H5315>life<s%>:
Let <S%H2336>thistles<s%> <S%H3318>grow<s%> instead of <S%H2406>wheat<s%>, and <S%H890>cockle<s%> instead of <S%H8184>barley<s%>. The <S%H1697>words<s%> of <S%H347>Job<s%> are <S%H8552>ended<s%>.
